Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is light-brown in section, with remains of four lines of black-painted demotic text on the interior, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of a further six lines of black-painted demotic text, dated year 6 and recording the purchase of land.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.46-7, pl.35)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (47615) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/47615)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Robert Curzon, 14th Baron Zouche
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Robert Curzon, 14th Baron Zouche
